content.question: The use of pesticides on crops has had significant negative effects on honeybee populations. The pesticide imidacloprid, which is used to control parasites like aphids, is highly toxic to bees in small concentrations. Imidacloprid has an <math alttext="L D 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD</mtext><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dose of <math alttext="78 nanograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>78</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per bee, which weigh, on average, 0.1 grams. Which of the following approaches would you use to calculate the amount of pesticide, in milligrams per gram of bees? (Note: <math alttext="1000 milligrams equals 1 million billion nanograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)

choices.label: <math alttext="78 nanograms over bee, times the fraction 1 bee over 0.1 gram, times the fraction 1 million nanograms over 1 milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>78</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 78 nanograms over bee, times 1 bee over 0.1 gram, times the fraction 1 milligram over 1 million nanograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>78</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 78 nanograms over bee, times the fraction 1 bee over 50, times the fraction 1 million nanograms over 1 milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>78</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 78 nanograms over bee, times the fraction 1 bee over 1 million nanograms, times 50 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>78</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 78 nanograms over bee, times 1 bee over 0.1 gram, times the fraction 1 milligram over 1 million nanograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>78</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>bee</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>ng</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Determine an approach or method aligned with the problem to be solved.
